intro: Senecio euryphyllus, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a frosty appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Senecio euryphyllus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and delicate blooms.
